snippet: As leading tech firms grow ever more prominent and pervasive, questions are increasingly being asked about their labor practices, attitudes toward customers' data, unyielding competitive streaks and other aspects of their corporate DNA. Is creatin...
abstract: As leading tech firms grow ever more prominent and pervasive, questions are increasingly being asked about their labor practices, attitudes toward customers' data, unyielding competitive streaks and other aspects of their corporate DNA. Is creating jobs and wealth for stockholders enough? When Amazon was in the cross hairs, Seattle said, "Leave 'em alone!"

snippet: A Trojan horse virus called “Fakeflash” or “Flashback’ is infecting Macs running OS X and has given criminals access to more than 600,000 computers.
abstract: A Trojan horse virus called “Fakeflash” or “Flashback’ is infecting Macs running OS X and has given criminals access to more than 600,000 computers.

headline.main: Widespread Virus Proves Macs Are No Longer Safe From Hackers

snippet: In a rare change of heart, AT&T has announced that it will begin allowing iPhone customers whose two-year contracts have expired to unlock their phones, meaning they can take their device and migrate to other carriers.
abstract: In a rare change of heart, AT&T has announced that it will begin allowing iPhone customers whose two-year contracts have expired to unlock their phones, meaning they can take their device and migrate to other carriers.

snippet: AT&T has said that the release of the Nokia Lumia 900 will be its biggest product introduction ever - but the phone is coming out on Easter Sunday, when some AT&T stores won't even be open.
abstract: AT&T has said that the release of the Nokia Lumia 900 will be its biggest product introduction ever - but the phone is coming out on Easter Sunday, when some AT&T stores won't even be open.

headline.main: Why Is AT&T Releasing Nokia's Big Phone on Easter?

snippet: There's no shortage of Republicans with an eye on the vice presidential slot.
abstract: There's no shortage of Republicans with an eye on the vice presidential slot.

snippet: Rapid sales of its Galaxy smartphones and the Note mini-tablet and phone drove its operating profit from January to March to $5.1 billion, almost double the level of a year ago.
Michael Grandage’s revival of Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice’s “Evita” at the Marquis Theater is stately, sincere and sober-sided.
More than 3,500 accounts belonging to registered sex offenders in New York have been shut down, following an agreement with the state attorney general.
abstract: Several video-game companies agree to close the online game-playing accounts of more than 3,500 registered sex offenders in New York State following an agreement with State Attorney General Eric T Schneiderman; move is intended to protect children from sexual predators who can use the Internet-based games to establish direct contact with minors.

headline.main: Video-Game Companies Agree to Close Sex Offenders’ Online Accounts
headline.print_headline: Video-Game Companies Agree to Close Sex Offenders’ Online Accounts

snippet: Facebook, which is preparing for its highly anticipated initial public offering, has picked a home.     The social network will list its shares under the ticker symbol FB on Nasdaq, according to people with knowledge of the matter, who requested a...
abstract: Facebook, which is preparing for its highly anticipated initial public offering, will list its shares under the ticker symbol FB on Nasdaq; it is a significant coup for the exchange. Photo (M)

headline.main: Facebook Is Said to Pick Nasdaq for Its Stock Listing
